CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper March 9, 1957, pg. 13, reads: "'Thank the Lord' - Prenis Parrish, owner of a six-room, three-story brick home at 63 Roberts St. in which his wife and seven children live, looks at the devastation wreaked in just one of the rooms and thanks the Lord that at least two room were left in livable shape and that all of his family, who were busy getting ready to go to Sunday school at 10 o'clock Saturday night, were still up, and escaped being burned to death or injured. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Prenis Parrish seated in windowsill and surrounded by rubble of his burned home, 63 Roberts Street, Hill District
